summary: 17 CFR § 230.152 outlines the principles of integration for securities offerings, determining when multiple offerings should be treated as one for registration purposes. It provides safe harbors to avoid integration if certain conditions are met, such as timing between offerings or compliance with specific regulations. The section also details when an offering is considered to commence or terminate, based on actions taken by the issuer or its agents.
